definition: dummy run/to run through sth/to rehearse
to advance/in advance/beforehand/to prepare
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: The Green Book was an exercise, if a daft one, in utopian totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 绿皮书就是乌托邦式的极权主义的拙劣预演。

sentences.english: The earlier protests had just been dress rehearsals for full-scale revolution.
sentences.chinese: 早期的抗议仅仅是大革命开始前的预演。

sentences.english: Previews for the play began on Thursday but the official opening is October 16.
sentences.chinese: 预演于周四开始，但正式的演出在10月16日。

sentences.english: The rehearsal ended with jumps by parachute teams.
sentences.chinese: 最后，八一跳伞队为本次预演画上了句号。

sentences.english: The complex logistical preparations will serve as a dry run for future efforts.
sentences.chinese: 综合的后勤准备会是未来实战的预演。

sentences.english: Role-play possible situations with the child.
sentences.chinese: 和孩子预演可能出现的险情。

sentences.english: His symphony was laughed off the stage at its first rehear sal.
sentences.chinese: 他的交响曲在第一次预演时就受到嘲笑而不能上演。

sentences.english: The Screen Designer is no longer a technology preview.
sentences.chinese: 界面设计器不再是一个技术上的预演。

sentences.english: So far, the mostly young audiences at the preview performances seem impressed.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止，以年轻人为主的观众似乎被预演打动了。

sentences.english: We rehearsed for days before the speech contest.
sentences.chinese: 我们在演讲比赛前预演了好几天。

sentences.english: They see the result they want clearly and rehearse it over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以清楚地看到想要的结果，一遍又一遍地预演。

sentences.english: Liu Yan, a dancer from Inner Mongolia, was paralyzed after falling when rehearsing for the opening ceremony of the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 内蒙舞蹈演员刘岩在奥运开幕式预演时因摔伤而残废。

sentences.english: Liu's magicis one of the most anticipated shows during the night.
sentences.chinese: 在春晚当天，刘谦将表演最先预演的魔术。

sentences.english: Trenberth regards extreme weather as an analogue, a dry run to the future.
sentences.chinese: 川伯斯认为，极端性天气是未来气候的类比和预演。

definition: to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
to do a drill/to practice/training/drill
dress rehearsal
to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
to deduce/to infer/to derive/an implication
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
the eve/the night before
a genius in retrospect (idiom); hindsight is 20-20
large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
item (on a program)
to recur (of events, esp. adverse ones)/to repeat (a performance)
to imagine/to assume/to envisage/tentative plan/to have consideration for
war/to wage war
